overEngineered.question: Okay, this thing is really over-engineered
overEngineered.answer: I know â€” but most of this doesn't affect the basic mirror functionality. I was bored, so I built it this way.

protocols.question: What protocols does this mirror support?
protocols.answer: This mirror supports HTTP, HTTPS (HTTP/2 and HTTP/3 via QUIC), FTP, rsync, and rsync over SSL.

formats.question: What directory listing formats are supported?
formats.answer: The server supports both HTML and JSON directory listings. You can control the output format using the <0>Accept</0> request header.

curl.question: Why does <0>curl ftp.io.kr</0> show unexpected output?
curl.answer: Because the domain starts with <0>ftp</0>, curl attempts the FTP protocol first. Although the FTP protocol still works, if you want HTML output, explicitly prefix the URL with <1>http://</1> or <2>https://</2>.

rsync.question: How do I use <0>rsync</0> with this mirror?
rsync.answer: The mirror exposes an rsync module named <0>arch</0>. You can test it with: <1>rsync-ssl --list-only ftp.io.kr::arch</1>
